markdown:
**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 134 2.0 **Prerequisites** Trained in [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) --- When you trick a foe, instead of catching them off guard, you goad them into overextending their next attack. On a successful [Feint](/Actions.aspx?ID=48), you can use the following success and critical success effects instead of any other effects that would occur when you Feint. You can choose a different effect each time you Feint against a given foe. **Critical Success** The target takes a –2 circumstance penalty to all attack rolls against you before the end of its next turn.
**Success** The target takes a –2 circumstance penalty to its next attack roll against you before the end of its next turn.
name: Overextending Feint
